channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: key parts of the economy will take two years to recover as state prepares to relax COVID-19 rules

item.description: Victoria Police has compiled a 12,000-page stack of documents that could help free criminals convicted over what was once the world's largest ecstasy import.
item.title: Police dossier on Gobbo and tomato-tin drug gang grows to 12,000 pages

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Daniel Andrews confirms back to school date for Victorian students as Australian unemployment rate nears 10 per cent, nation's death toll stands at 97

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Daniel Andrews announces back to school plan, Wuhan reports new cluster

item.description: Despite scandals and crises, executive compensation has remained too generous, too opaque and too loosely linked to long-term goals. The upheaval wrought by the COVID-19 pandemic provides the opportunity for a remake.
item.title: Goodbye hefty bonuses: Coronavirus could finally shake up CEO pay

item.dc:creator: Jenna Price
item.description: Some critics described the whole reading-to-Archie event as phony and attention-seeking. But the Duke and Duchess know something they don't.
item.title: What Meghan and Harry know about storybook time – and you should too

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The two-month parking amnesty will be over from Monday to boost Brisbane's return to normal, lord mayor Adrian Schrinner says.
item.title: Parking fees return to Brisbane from Monday

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: New York's daily coronavirus death toll fell below 200 for the first time since late March, prompting cautious optimism from Governor Andrew Cuomo.
item.title: 'On the other side of the mountain': New York begins to re-open after coronavirus havoc

item.description: Four-time Formula One world champion Sebastian Vettel will reportedly quit Ferrari at the end of the year, potentially opening the door for Australian ace Daniel Ricciardo.
item.title: Vettel set to leave Ferrari: reports

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: Andrew Weldon has been a contributor to The Age and The Sunday Age for many years. His cartoons have been published widely nationally and internationally, including in The New Yorker, The Spectator and Private Eye. He has published two book collections of his work and several childrens' books. He smells funny.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Weldon

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: New Zealand's health services scrambled to reconfigure after the arrival of COVID-19 to Kiwi shores, forcing thousands of people to put off their health needs.
item.title: New Zealand budgets for post-lockdown surgeries backlog

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Regional Express Airlines says it plans to start flying jet aircraft between mainland capital cities in a direct challenge to Qantas, Jetstar and Virgin Australia.
item.title: Regional Express to take on Qantas and Virgin with capital city flights

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Jones' departure papers over the financial cracks in his radio program. His Ardern comments were the final straw.
item.title: An advertiser exodus meant the writing was on the wall for Alan Jones

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Turning points in AFL history don't come much bigger than the one that occurred as a result of a players' meeting at Glenferrie Oval 50 years ago this month.
item.title: The May meeting 50 years ago that made Hawthorn bloom

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 12, 2020

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: Paul Motian used an unknown folk-singer to make a classic jazz album.
item.title: The man who helped save jazz from itself

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: North CEO Ben Amarfio said the Kangaroos wanted to fulfil their "big commitment in Tassie" in this season's shortened competition.
item.title: North Melbourne ask AFL for four Hobart games in revised fixture

item.description: "Shutting your eyes and trying to drive through this blind is about as silly an equation as I've seen," WHO's Dr Michael Ryan said.
item.title: As countries reopen, WHO warns about severe lack of virus tracing

item.description: There are some powerful forces that may stand in the way of the economy bouncing back quickly after the pandemic is under control.
item.title: Ripple effect: The US is facing years of economic pain

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Temporary ban on sale of firearms and ammunition in Victoria to be lifted at 11.59 tonight, with sport and target shooting and recreational hunting to restart.
item.title: Ban on gun, ammo sales to go, shooting allowed 'if you really need to'

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: The ASX-listed building products giant has ditched its payout to shareholders and its CEO and other senior executives have forfeited short-term bonuses.
item.title: CSR ditches final dividend, prepares for weaker construction demand

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The couple were surprised by their good fortune when they discovered they had won days after the numbers were drawn.
item.title: Retired Queensland couple won almost $9 million without knowing it

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: There are positive signs consumers are opening their wallets as restrictions aimed at stopping the spread of the coronavirus are eased.
item.title: Shops start to open and consumers start to spend

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Refugee activists have occupied the Mantra hotel in Preston to protest the detention of asylum seekers during the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Refugee activists occupy Preston hotel housing medevac detainees

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Detectives believe the victim did not know his alleged attackers prior to Monday night's confrontation.
item.title: Teenage boy stabbed in chest at Brisbane train station

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Roberts' uncle, former NRL star Amos Roberts, has told the Herald his nephew had been in good spirits when they last spoke.
item.title: 'He's being brave': Souths star James Roberts enters rehab for a third time

item.description: England internationals Danny Rose and Raheem Sterling have criticised a return of the English Premier League during the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: 'People's lives are at risk': England stars blast EPL return

item.description: With financial benchmarks and priorities in flux, it's important to know in granular detail exactly where your money goes.
item.title: How to track spending and reach your savings goals

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Billionaire Solomon Lew's retail chains will reopen almost all of their stores starting Friday after the coronavirus shutdown which wiped out nearly three-quarters of sales.
item.title: Premier Investments moves to reopen stores after six-week lockdown decimated sales

item.description: The PM said he understood why some people were "perplexed" by the regulations and on Monday night was urged by members of the public to clarify the rules.
item.title: Johnson tells public to use 'British common sense' on lockdown rules

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: The Greens will move a motion to strip Police Commissioner Mick Fuller of his $87,000 pay rise in the NSW upper house on Tuesday.
item.title: Berejiklian rebukes attempt to reverse police chief's pay rise

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: A man in his 60s is in police custody after a woman's body was found at a home in the state's east.
item.title: Man held after woman's body found in isolated East Gippsland township

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: The ASX200 is down 1.5 per cent, more than 70 points, falling below 5400 again. Financials, materials, and real estate are dragging.
item.title: ASX falling as business conditions tumble

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Beale’s departure means Michael Hooper is now the only remaining Waratahs player from the team that beat the Crusaders in the 2014 decider.
item.title: Kurtley Beale to quit Waratahs for stint in France

item.dc:creator: Rick Feneley
item.description: The arrest comes more than 30 years after an initially bungled police investigation concluded the 27-year-old US mathematician had died by suicide.
item.title: Man arrested over 1988 murder of Scott Johnson

item.description: A Perth grandfather has been charged after allegedly driving through a border checkpoint and leading police on a chase for more than an hour.
item.title: Perth grandfather leads police on chase after 'speeding through border checkpoint'

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: A man was found dead just before 8pm on Monday evening after a gunshot was reportedly heard by locals.
item.title: Man arrested after death in Melbourne's south-east, gunshots heard

item.description: It has taken 12 years from financial crisis to COVID-19 to see the pendulum swing back again to the economic and social order that will most likely dominate the next 30 years.
item.title: What the new economic world order will look like after the virus

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The body of the 37-year-old male victim was found about 4pm on Wednesday at Woodford Correctional Centre.
item.title: Prisoner charged with murder after inmate found dead in laundry

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The weather bureau expects the mercury to gradually increase before another cold snap arrives towards the end of the week.
item.title: Brisbane drops 1.5 degrees below average on another chilly Queensland morning

item.description: The presentation notes that the technology is used to create "fake celebrity pornographic videos" but might be repurposed for Holocaust remembrance.
item.title: High-concept outrage planned in Ukraine is funded by Russian oligarchs

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Tuesday, May 12

item.description: Some children will return to school from May 26, with all pupils back by June 9.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: WA has emerged as the front line in a new China trade dispute, with the state's billion-dollar barley industry at risk over Beijing's threat to tax Australian imports and experts warning the West needs to look elsewhere for its future prosperity.
item.title: WA emerges as front line in billion-dollar China trade war

item.dc:creator: Aja Styles
item.description: A loosening of alfresco restrictions by local governments won’t make an inch of difference to many cafes and restaurants wishing to reopen their in-house dining come May 18.
item.title: Alfresco solution is 'not sunshine and roses' for WA cafes as councils scramble to meet Phase 2

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: Principals are calling for compulsory education, not compulsory attendance, as the number of students not attending school and not engaging in remote learning remains concerning.
item.title: 'Compulsory education, not attendance': WA principals want school learning options to remain

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: An organisation dedicated to informing people about what they say is the cruel practice of greyhound racing has slammed the industry following the death of a dog south of Perth last week.
item.title: 'Carnage': Greyhound industry slammed after dog death south of Perth
